ques: How can I attain a peace of mind?
ans: if we want to attain peace of mind, we should do our sacrifices and austerities for the Lord. This is the only way to attain peace of mind. The second verse says that the yogi of controlled mind achieves the Peace which culminates in Liberation and which abides in Me. So, if we want to attain peace of mind, we should control our mind. The third verse says that the man who has faith, is diligent and has control over the organs, attains Knowledge. Achieving Knowledge, one soon attains supreme Peace. So, if we want to attain peace of mind, we should have faith, be diligent and control our organs. The fourth verse says that the unsteady man has no wisdom, and there is no meditation for the unsteady man. And for an unmeditative man there is no peace.

ques: Can you explain the significance of the Gita's teachings on the threefold division of faith based on the modes of nature?
ans: The three modes of nature are the three gunas, sattva, rajas and tamas. They are the three qualities of nature that are present in all of us.
